content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Mining and Smelting Setup at (-21.0, -73.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (position -21.0, -73.0)
- Iron chest for ore collection (position -21.5, -74.5)
- Burner inserter (position -20.5, -74.5)
- Stone furnace for smelting (position -19.0, -74.0)

### Iron Mining Setup at (-2.0, -76.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill (position -2.0, -76.0)
- Iron chest for ore collection (position -1.5, -74.5)

### Iron Plate Production Line
Complex setup consisting of:
- Iron chest for plate storage (position 1.5, -74.5)
- Burner inserter (position 0.5, -74.5)
- Additional iron chest (position 3.5, -75.5)
- Two stone furnaces (positions 3.0, -73.0 and 5.0, -73.0)
- Multiple burner inserters (positions 3.5, -74.5 and 5.5, -74.5)
- Output iron chest (position 7.5, -72.5)
- Complex belt system connecting various components:
  - Vertical belt group from (1.5, -74.5) to (1.5, -72.5)
  - Horizontal belt group from (0.5, -70.5) to (7.5, -69.5)
  - Belt group around (-0.5, -71.5) to (1.5, -71.5)
  - Long vertical belt group from (0.5, -71.5) to (8.5, -74.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Pickup Errors
- Before attempting to pick up an entity, verify that the entity exists at the specified position
- Double check coordinates when trying to pick up entities

### Resource Management Issues
- Monitor chest capacity: The iron ore mining drill's chest is getting full, implement a system to empty chests regularly
- Ensure mining drills have sufficient fuel to operate (copper mining drill is out of fuel)

### Production Line Efficiency
- Multiple furnaces show "no ingredients to smelt" warning - ensure proper material flow through the production line
- Some inserters are waiting for source items - verify the logistics chain is properly connected and supplied
